text: Allegheny Mountain (spelling as Alleghany Mountain in Virginia) is a major mountain ridge in the southern range of the Allegheny Mountains, part of the Appalachian Mountains. It forms the Eastern Continental Divide along part of its course and also serves as part of the Virginia-West Virginia state line. Elevations of are exceeded along much of Allegheny Mountain. ==Major peaks== Listed from southwest to northeast: * Hickory Knob - * Smith Knob * Chestnut Knob * High Top (Lookout Tower) * Chestnut Levels * Mad Tom * Mad Sheep - * Paddy Knob - * Bald Knob * Watering Pond Knob * Bear Mountain * Top of Allegheny (site of Camp Allegheny battlefield) * Tamarack Ridge * Grassy Knob ==Principal gaps== * Rucker Gap * Ryder Gap ==See also== *Monongahela National Forest *George Washington National Forest *Battle of Camp Allegheny ==References== Category:Allegheny Mountains Category:Ridges of West Virginia Category:Ridges of Virginia Category:Ridges of Pocahontas County, West Virginia Category:Landforms of Greenbrier County, West Virginia Category:Landforms of Alleghany County, Virginia Category:Landforms of Bath County, Virginia Category:Landforms of Highland County, Virginia Category:Monongahela National Forest Category:Borders of Virginia Category:Borders of West Virginia
title: Allegheny Mountain (West Virginia – Virginia)
